title: Ryll-Nardzewski fixed-point theorem
summary: In functional analysis, a branch of mathematics, the Ryll-Nardzewski fixed-point theorem states that if E {\displaystyle E} is a normed vector space and K {\displaystyle K} is a nonempty convex subset of E {\displaystyle E} that is compact under the weak topology, then every group (or equivalently: every semigroup) of affine isometries of K {\displaystyle K} has at least one fixed point. (Here, a fixed point of a set of maps is a point that is fixed by each map in the set.)
